title: Yarn add is not working
body:
## Problem 
While running any yarn add command like `yarn add react-native-share@7.0.2`, it is showing error

`error /home/parvesh_monu/Desktop/ArchFiles/React/status-mobile/node_modules/better-sqlite3: Command failed.`

<details>
  <summary>Complete Error </summary>

```
[status-mobile]-> yarn add react-native-share@7.0.2
yarn add v1.22.19
$ make status-go-library
nix/scripts/build.sh targets.status-go.library
```

### Additional Information

- Status version: develop 
- Operating System: Arch Linux

Thank @siddarthkay for testing. (not able to reproduce)
```
siddarthkumar@Siddarths-MacBook-Pro status-mobile % node -v
v16.18.1
```
My node version 19.4.0 on both, linux and mac.
but it should be inside nix shell ?
yup, running yarn add command inside nix shell is working

Well, we pin Node to `16.x` for a reason:
https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/aa8f5b3d48a8d4b5ee2a3d7373675d4150634126/nix/overlay.nix#L37-L38
So I'd say yes, you should be using the Nix shell, since that's what it's for. To keep the tooling stable and locked.
